item.title: Find the group for user defined collections.
item.description: In the Catalog view look for a group name "user defined". Select this group. If you like you can edit the groups label with a double click.

item.title: Creating a new collection.
item.description: Perform a right click on the group and select "Create new collection".

item.title: Naming the new collection.
item.description: Type "Panorama" into the Name field of the dialog. Into the Description field type "Panorama are images with an Aspect Ratio of at least 2.0". You may notice that the description is automatically spell-checked if a dictionary was installed.

item.title: Specifying the search criteria.
item.description: In the dialog field Group select "Properties". This is not essential but it makes it easier to find the required entry in the next dialog field. In the dialog field Field select now "Aspect Ratio". This meta-data element contains the width of an image divided by its height. In the field Relation select ">=" to find all images with a greater or equal value than the value entered in the next field. Finally enter "2" into the field Value.

item.title: Sorting the results.
item.description: The next line of fields in the Collection Edit Dialog is preset to sort the images found by creation date. You can accept this or enter a new sort criterion. For example, if you want to sort images by Aspect Ratio (widest images first), select "Aspect Ratio" in field Sort Field and "descending" in field Sort Direction.

item.title: Finishing up.
item.description: Now, press OK to save your new collection. After a short while the current gallery will show all panorama. Later, you can just return and select the collection to show the panorama again. Note, that all collections are "life". When new images are added, they will be shown in the collection if they meet the criteria defined in the collection.

intro.description: Creating a user defined collection In this tutorial you're going to create a user defined collection. In particular, we want to find all panorama in the catalog. A panorama can be defined by an aspect ratio of at least 2.0.
